articles.headline: Truth in a Post-Truth Era: Sandy Hook Families Sue Alex Jones, Conspiracy Theorist
articles.snippet: The cases seek a verdict on “post truth” culture and on Mr. Jones, a Trump ally who reaps millions peddling bogus claims about an American tragedy.
articles.abstract: The cases seek a verdict on “post truth” culture and on Mr. Jones, a Trump ally who reaps millions peddling bogus claims about an American tragedy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After the body of Jesse Lewis, age 6, was recovered from his classroom at Sandy Hook Elementary School, his father, Neil Heslin, cradled him for a final time. At the top of Jesse’s forehead was the gunshot wound that ended his life. “It meant a lot to be able to see him,” Mr. Heslin said in an interview. “When he was born, I was the first to see him, and I was the last one to hold him.”

articles.headline: Jared Kushner Gets Security Clearance, Ending Swirl of Questions Over Delay
articles.snippet: Mr. Kushner’s F.B.I. background check had dragged on, fueling questions about whether the special counsel had found evidence that made him a security risk.
articles.abstract: Mr. Kushner’s F.B.I. background check had dragged on, fueling questions about whether the special counsel had found evidence that made him a security risk.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Jared Kushner, President Trump’s son-in-law and senior adviser, has been granted his permanent security clearance, a person briefed on the matter said on Wednesday, ending a period of uncertainty that had fueled questions about whether Mr. Kushner was in peril in the special counsel investigation.

articles.headline: Trump’s Blocking of Twitter Users Is Unconstitutional, Judge Says
articles.snippet: A federal judge in Manhattan ruled on Wednesday that President Trump’s practice of blocking Twitter users who criticize him is unconstitutional.
articles.abstract: A federal judge in Manhattan ruled on Wednesday that President Trump’s practice of blocking Twitter users who criticize him is unconstitutional.
articles.lead_paragraph: Apart from the man himself, perhaps nothing has defined President Trump’s political persona more than Twitter.
articles.byline: By John Herrman and Charlie Savage

articles.headline: Massachusetts Gains Foothold in Offshore Wind Power, Long Ignored in U.S.
articles.snippet: The wind farms have increasingly become mainstream sources of power in Northern Europe, but the United States has largely not pursued the technology.
articles.abstract: The wind farms have increasingly become mainstream sources of power in Northern Europe, but the United States has largely not pursued the technology.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW BEDFORD, Mass. — On the waterfront of this fabled former whaling hub, the outlines of a major new industry are starting to appear.
articles.byline: By Stanley Reed and Ivan Penn

articles.headline: Emerging Markets Are Worrying Investors, Again
articles.snippet: Argentina and now Turkey have been forced to raise interest rates to defend their currencies from growing pressure on emerging markets.
articles.abstract: Argentina and now Turkey have been forced to raise interest rates to defend their currencies from growing pressure on emerging markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: Add a familiar item to the list of worries for investors: turmoil in the emerging markets.
articles.byline: By Matt Phillips and Landon Thomas Jr

articles.headline: Apple, Spurned by Others, Signs Deal With Volkswagen for Driverless Cars
articles.snippet: BMW and Mercedes-Benz rebuffed Apple’s overtures for a self-driving car partnership, according to people familiar with the talks.
articles.abstract: BMW and Mercedes-Benz rebuffed Apple’s overtures for a self-driving car partnership, according to people familiar with the talks.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple once had grand aspirations to build its own electric self-driving car and lead the next generation of transportation. Over time, the tech giant’s ambitions ran into reality.

articles.headline: Trump Pulls Out of North Korea Summit Meeting With Kim Jong-un
articles.snippet: The meeting was scheduled for June 12 in Singapore, and Mr. Trump said it “will not take place.” But he later said it could still happen.
articles.abstract: The meeting was scheduled for June 12 in Singapore, and Mr. Trump said it “will not take place.” But he later said it could still happen.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Thursday pulled out of a highly anticipated summit meeting with Kim Jong-un, accusing the North Koreans of bad faith and lamenting that “this missed opportunity is a truly sad moment in history.”

articles.headline: Trump’s Lawyer and Chief of Staff Appear at Briefings on F.B.I.’s Russia Informant
articles.snippet: The presence of Emmet T. Flood, a lawyer representing the president in the Russia investigation, and John F. Kelly, the chief of staff, at the start of the classified meetings infuriated Democrats.
articles.abstract: The presence of Emmet T. Flood, a lawyer representing the president in the Russia investigation, and John F. Kelly, the chief of staff, at the start of the classified meetings infuriated Democrats.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s chief of staff and a White House lawyer representing the president in the Russia investigation were present on Thursday at the start of two classified meetings requested by members of Congress to review sensitive material about the F.B.I.’s use of an informant in the inquiry.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Fandos and Katie Benner
